In-Depth Insights üîç

  • Swiss Cheese & Vertical Software üíª
    Most VC filters are lazy - Euclid says forget TAM and focus on multivariate risk to find real winners in Vertical AI. [Euclid Ventures]

  • AI Is Eating Venture Capital üìâ
    VC firms are slashing headcount as AI takes over sourcing, diligence, and ops - 50% cuts are just the beginning. [Ben Bergman]

  • India‚Äôs PE Surge Amid Trade Tensions üåç
    As China stumbles, global PE giants double down on India - buoyed by exits, digital growth, and trade tailwinds. [Emily Lai]

  • Most-Active US Investors: April 2025 üíµ
    VC deal activity slumped in April - only a16z and Khosla cracked 10+ deals, signaling continued caution across the board. [Chris Metinko]

  • VC‚Äôs Sum of All Fears üìâ
    Klarna, Chime, and others freeze IPO plans - LP pain, closed exits, and zero goodwill are spooking venture capital. [Dan Primack]

  • Barriers to Entry in Venture Capital üß±
    Emerging Managers face steep startup costs, bias against first-time funds, and brand gaps - VC isn‚Äôt built for newcomers. [Christian Hernandez]

Interesting Reports üìä

  • Drake Star: $86B Sports Tech Deals, Top Early VCs üìä

  • CVC Deals Hit 7-Year Low, AI Still Dominates üí∏
    CVC deal volume drops to 728 - lowest since 2018. Median deal size up. 7 of top 10 deals go to AI. Salesforce Ventures leads. [CB Insights]

    $300M poured into anti-aging bets. NewLimit raised $72.3M. Bezos and Altman are in. Science still early - momentum isn‚Äôt. [PitchBook]
